title: Inquiry-Based Genetic Modeling: Understanding Molecular-Cellular-Genotypic-Phenotypic Connections

context.prior_knowledge: Basic life science concepts (cell structure, DNA structure) and high school-level genetics knowledge
context.additional_context: Some educational participants are completing teaching credentials, while others are prospective graduates preparing for careers in life sciences.

learning_goals: Constructing a schema that integrates the three tiers of genetic models (inheritance, meiosis, and molecular mechanisms)

Using virtual lab tools (e.g., PhET simulations), learners derive quantitative analyses with ≥80% accuracy for 5 genetics problems via Punnett squares and gene frequency calculations and establish predictive models.

Learners simulate transcription-translation processes in gene expression using digital modeling tools (e.g., CellDesigner, COPASI), link CRISPR-Cas9 mechanisms to these models, and explain ≥3 biological scenarios (e.g., gene knockout, expression regulation).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
